character.aliases: シロエ Villain in Glasses Shiroe the Strategist Black Heart Glasses Dark Shiroe Chronicler of the East
character.name: Shiroe

concept.deck: The Jersey Chronicles is the name for the universe where the characters from the town of Leonardo, New Jersey who hang around the area of the Quick Stop and RST Video.
concept.description:
The Cannon

There are many movies included in the Jersey Chronicles and comics.  The films are Clerks, Mallrats, Chasing Amy, Dogma, Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back and Clerks II.  Although there are many characters who are in the Jersey Chronicles the list below are the ones who have appeared in comic books. 
 

The Characters

Silent Bob Also Known as Bluntman

Silent Bob is played by writer, director and creator of the Jersey Chronicles Kevin Smith.  Silent Bob is aptly named because he rarely says anything and when he does it is quite often deep and profound.  The likeness of the character Silent Bob is transformed by Holden McNeil and Banky Edwards into Bluntman  for their comic book .
 

Jay Also Known as Chronic  

Jay is the partner in crime of Silent Bob and played by Jay.  Where Silent Bob is quiet, Jay is a harsh, coarse, crude, and obnoxious.They both sell drugs and fireworks outside the Quick Stop and RST Video.  

The likeness of the character Jay is transformed by Holden McNeil and Banky Edwards into Chronic for their comic book. 

Dante Hicks 

Dante is a clerk who mainly works at the Quick Stop in New Jersey.  He is a sad sack character who seem to always get the short end of the stick.   

Randal Graves 

Randal works mainly next door to Dante at the RST Video.  Just like Jay, Randal is the the partner in crime of Dante.  He is also a much more brash and obnoxious than Dante.   Randal however is a little more quick witted than Jay.
 

Alyssa Jones 

Alyssa is a friend Dante's and others in the Jersey Chronicles.  She was also friends with Julie Dwyer who dated Dante and later died at the YMCA pool.
  

Steve-Dave 

Steve-Dave is an over bearing know it all who runs his own comic shop and has many run ins with other Jersey Chronicles characters especially Randal who tried to put him out of business selling Star Wars action figures.

Walt Grover    

Walt is the sidekick to Steve-Dave.  Walt is the ultimate fanboy and is Steve-Dave's total lackey.  

Julie Dwyer 

Julie has never been seen alive in the movies but has appeared in at least one comic in a flash back.  She has also been mentioned in at least three movies.

She dated Dante and later died swimming in the YMCA pool.
concept.name: Jersey Chronicles

location.deck: Toronto newspaper owned by August Fenwick.
location.description:
Overview

The "Toronto Daily Chronicle" was once considered a dirt-sheet, far behind the "Toronto Sentinel" in readership. Over the years, after being purchased by Toronto billionaire August Fenwick, the paper earned a great deal of respectability. Under the leadership of editor-in-chief Timothy J. Pearly, the "Chronicle" hired away the "Sentinel's" star reporter, Jack Peters, and enjoyed a long life at the top of the news game.
location.name: Toronto Daily Chronicle Building

issue.description:
After developing his acclaimed style of firsthand reporting with his bestselling graphic novels Pyongyang: A Journey in North Korea and Shenzhen: A Travelogue From China, Guy Delisle is back with Burma Chronicles. In this country notorious for its use of concealment and isolation as social control-where scissor-wielding censors monitor the papers, the leader of the opposition has spent twelve of the past eighteen years under house arrest, insurgent-controlled regions are effectively cut off from the world, and rumor is the most reliable source of current information-he turns his gaze to the everyday for a sense of the big picture.

Delisle's deft and recognizable renderings take note of almsgiving rituals, daylong power outages, and rampant heroin use in outlying regions, in this place where catastrophic mismanagement and iron-handed rule come up against profound resilience of spirit, expatriate life ambles along, and nongovernmental organizations struggle with the risk of co-option by the military junta.Burma Chronicles is drawn with a minimal line, and interspersed with wordless vignettes and moments of Delisle's distinctive slapstick humor.
issue.name: Burma Chronicles

issue.description:
This collects short stories on The Phantom in prose format both in hardcover and softcover.

This book has the first team-up ever of The Phantom and the Green Hornet, and a brand-new story written by Harlan Ellison.

To the outside world, this man, seemingly immortal, has always worn the mask. As the legend grew, it transcended the life of any one mortal. And that legend became The Phantom.

This book has a special feature - introduction by Phantom creator Lee Falk's daughter, Diane Falk.
issue.name: The Phantom Chronicles

issue.description:
Mandy Flynn, a 19-century London prostitute, happens upon an alien, Bozz, who is "shipwrecked" on Earth and wants to kill himself out of despondency. Instead they join up to improve both their lives and become Boswell & Flynn, Consulting Detectives.

In their first case, they find out about Lord Giles Morgan, who seems to be immortal, having been declared dead multiple times in the past. A mysterious string of deaths by what seem to be targeted lightning strikes also seems to be connected.

Using a combination of Mandy's street moxie and Bozz's alien abilities, they find the source of the electrical disturbances: a strange machine, built by the mad scientist Dr. Pretorius, who was financed by the Hand of Four. The Hand of Four, a group of plutocrats, are using Lord Morgan to try to take over the government. In turn, they are giving him eternal life through the machine's many powers. They capture Bozz with the electrical machine's stasis field. Mandy escapes and returns with Salem Hawkshaw, an American cowboy and boxer she found on the street. Luckily he loves to mix it up, and together they manage to rescue Bozz and defeat the Hand of Four.

Salem joins the detective team, but they have also caught the eye of Inspector Fitzroy of Scotland Yard, who takes notice of their unusual interests.
issue.name: The Bozz Chronicles

issue.description: Trade-paperback compilation of AC’s 1990 She-Cat solo book miniseries (comprised of She-Cat #’s 1-4) in a squarebound format, utilizing AC’s only die-cut cover EVER. Extremely low- run when it was produced in 1996, story and art is by Billie Marimon, John Dell, Ralph Cabrera, Mark Propst, with edits by Bill Black & Mark Heike. Standard comic book size, b&w with color covers, 108 pages.
issue.name: She-Cat Chronicles

issue.description: Collects the entire run of Groo Chronicles.
issue.name: Groo Chronicles HC

issue.description:
The Chapbook originally came with the first plus issue of the volume: The Phantom Chronicles. This is a very rare 6" x 9" color cover saddle-stiched book that shows the art that was not used for the Chronicles earlier. It also features insights and liner notes from artist Rubén Procopio. The interiors of the chapbook are black and white on manilla stock, 28pgs.

These came out in a very limited numbers. They were also sold by Moonstone separately for a short period.
issue.name: The Phantom Chronicles Artist's Annex

issue.description: A collection of ilustrations of The Batman Chronicles' heroes and villains by different artists.
issue.name: The Batman Chronicles Gallery

issue.description: Published by FantaCo Enterprises, Inc. in February, 1982.  Followed by The Daredevil Chronicles and then The Avengers Chronicles.
issue.name: The Fantastic Four Chronicles

volume.description: The Kane Chronicles was originally a series of books by Rick Riordan. They are about two siblings, Carter and Sadie Kane, who find themselves to be Egyptian magicians who can use the power of Egyptian Gods.
volume.name: Kane Chronicles

volume.description:
Welcome to Goldwood Kingdom where cute furry animals, birds and other creatures struggle to survive, find happiness and make the most of their lives. Will they succeed?

Goldwood Chronicles is a series of short stories for kids and grown-ups alike, following the lives of wild animals.
volume.name: Goldwood Chronicles

volume.deck: Collects a vast amount of Shadowhawk's adventures.
volume.description: Large, black and white trade paperbacks collecting the first original issues of Shadowhawk.
volume.name: Shadowhawk Chronicles

volume.description: Collects the Marvel Epic series Groo Chronicles #1-6.
volume.name: Groo Chronicles

episode.description: A White Martian called Armek comes to National City with the intention of bringing M'gann back to Mars to be punished for her treason.
episode.name: The Martian Chronicles

episode.description:
Japanese title: Neji Gaiden (ネジ外伝)

During the Chunin Exam, Neji rests in the medical room, having lost to Naruto. Just as Tenten comes in to check up on him, they see the Leaf Village attacked by Orochimaru and his men.
episode.name: Neji Chronicles

last_episode.name: Buddy Blue Ray and The Golden Bunnies

series.deck: A web series from DC and Machinima.
series.description:
A web-series the that debuted on Machinima starting June the 8th in America, 2015. The series is created by Bruce Timm.

It is set in a alternate world where Superman is General Zod's son, Batman is a vampire Kirk Langstrom and Wonder Woman is Bekka of the New Gods. The first season consisted of 3 epsiodes.

It was renewed for a second series in 2016 before it's release. The second season will have 10 episodes.
series.name: Justice League Gods and Monsters Chronicles
